qas.question: What is the growth forecast for Cambodia in 2009?
How much were remittances sent from migrant workers in 2007?
How many people live below the poverty line in Bangladesh?
What does Bruno Wenn of the German DEG recommend to attract new investors?

answers.text: sound economic policymaking and good governance

qas.question: According to Overseas Development Institute, what is one reason for the reduction in growth in developing countries?

context: Some developing countries that had seen strong economic growth saw significant slowdowns. For example, growth forecasts in Cambodia show a fall from more than 10% in 2007 to <a0_0>close to zero<a0_0/> in 2009, and Kenya may achieve only 3–4% growth in 2009, down from 7% in 2007. According to the research by the Overseas Development Institute, reductions in growth can be attributed to <a4_0>falls in trade<a4_0/>, commodity prices, investment and remittances sent from migrant workers (which reached a record <a1_0>$251 billion<a1_0/> in 2007, but have fallen in many countries since). This has stark implications and has led to a dramatic rise in the number of households living below the poverty line, be it <a2_0>300,000<a2_0/> in Bangladesh or 230,000 in Ghana. Especially states with a fragile political system have to fear that investors from Western states withdraw their money because of the crisis. Bruno Wenn of the German DEG recommends to provide a <a3_0>sound economic policymaking and good governance<a3_0/> to attract new investors
